lines.text:
[holding back his attack]
I'll not fight with a lady.

[thrusting her rapier at the soldier]
I'm no lady when I fight!
[first lines]

The year 1648 was a grim one for France. With the death of the great Cardinal Richelieu, the strong hand holding the country together was gone. Terror and violence ruled as the power-hungry nobles plotted to gain control.
You sent for me, Mother?
A messenger has just brought this, my son.
The Queen's ring!
Her Majesty must be in great danger, else she would not have sent that.
Then I must go at once - for my father. Planchet, saddle my horse!
[D'Artagnan's mother has given her son her husband's famous sword]
My father's sword! Now I have a legend to live up to.
Use it well and wisely.
I will use it as my father would have - with honor and in the Queen's name.
A moment, monsieurs. Why do you follow me?
We do not follow you.
Then let me put it this way... why is it that I always seem to be a little ahead of you?
Perhaps it is because we happen to be going your way.
lines.character: Second Regent's Guardsman at Fallen Tree

lines.text: And which way is that, Monsieur?
Bordeaux.
Bordeaux? You lie! The road to Bordeaux is half a league back.
Regent's Guards are not accustomed to being called liars!
And the King's Musketeer is not accustomed to being followed... by liars!
Ah, it is useless. I had hoped to ride with you, but I cannot. Devil take this gout! And yet, young D'Artagnan and Aramis ride in their fathers' steeds.
Then I shall ride for you!
Then one for all!
One for all!
And all for one!
All for one!
Ride hard and fast, my lads!
[D'Artagnan has just rescued the Dauphin from the Duke de LaValle, who was holding the Prince hostage]
And now your Grace, hide behind your sword!
[last lines]
God bless the King!
God bless the King!

[to D'Artagnan]
You stood pain well, monsieur. Now we'll see how you can face death.
who hunts the eagle does not notice the sparrow.
